conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: ALT is greater than 3 times and less than or equal to 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: ALT is greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Neutrophils decrease more than 30% from baseline and are below the reference range.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% ↓ from baseline AND Neutrophils below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury
conditions.description: Bilirubin is greater than 2 times ULN accompanied by ALT greater than 3 times ULN.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Concern Preventing Titration
conditions.description: Safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk for dose increase.
conditions.text: unless there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk

conditions.name: Serious Hypersensitivity Reaction
conditions.description: Occurrence of a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

conditions.name: Severe Uncontrolled Infection
conditions.description: Occurrence of a severe uncontrolled infection.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Participant becomes pregnant or plans to become pregnant.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Moderate ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 5 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Low Hemoglobin
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Low Platelets
transitionRules.text: If Platelets < 100,000/mm3, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2 × ULN and ALT > 3 × ULN, temporary interruption of dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data.

transitionRules.name: Maintain 15mg Dose
transitionRules.text: participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study if there are safety concerns.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a Serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a Severe uncontrolled infection occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for Use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretion Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Safety Review
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Lab Abnormalities
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose modification based on specific laboratory safety parameters meeting criteria outlined in the dose modification table.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Clinical Worsening
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose modification based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening, requiring evaluation by Investigator and Medical Monitor.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Intervention Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to permanently discontinue study intervention based on specific safety or compliance events.
